Overall I would easily recommend this property for travelers wanting to be in the heart of it all - near the beach, great restaurants, shops, etc., but not wanting to pay exorbitant prices.
title: Great location & value for Seminyak/Legian

text:
Artemis is situated away from the busy streets, so throughout our 4-day stay, we weren't affected by thumping beats from even the clubs or restaurants nearby. This was something we very much appreciated. 
Beds were very comfortable too, albeit the occurrence of ants on the bed (we didn't have meals in the villa at all in the 4 days; no snacks in the bedrooms either) on the first night we spent. Bit my companions in the night. Rest of us slept like babies. 
Mosquitoes were aplenty, but the resort provided us with an assortment of defence tools eg. mosquito coils, sprays, patches (which you can plug into one of the sockets in the rooms). 
Having a pool to ourselves was also a luxury we enjoyed, so if you're travelling as a group, book the villas. 
As for breakfast, I am personally really happy with the fare they've provided. With different diets in mind, they have basic meal sets that you can choose from - American, Intercontinental, Indonesian. The staff will take your orders, then prepare your food accordingly. Simple fare, but it was good and filled the tummy.
The staff was also very friendly and helpful. They respond to calls for help very promptly, and with good attitude. They're awesome! 
And...FREE WIFI. Not that we needed it a lot, but we were readily able to communicate with loved ones back home and that was something we appreciated.

Drawbacks of staying in a property away from the main streets, however, also meant that we had to cab a lot to the various food places, because walking for 15-30mins under the humidity and heat can be really trying. This was something I wish I read in the reviews prior to travelling.
Mosquitoes are pretty big and strong here, so you might wish to bring your own personal mosquito patches, especially if you're travelling with kids.
title: Comfortable and peaceful resting place; beware of commando mosquitoes.

text: We stayed here for a week recently in the hotel rooms. the rooms were clean, spacious and overall we were happy. however there were two major drawbacks for us. there were two huge sklyights in the room that meant we were woken at around 5am as the room filled with bright sunlight. we had to sleep with flannels on our face to get any kind of sleep past 7:30AM. secondly, the bed was possible the most uncomfortable i have ever had the displeasure of sleeping on. like a sheet of rock.  the room service menu is extensive and from what we tried, it was decent. the pool area was stunning. very close to the beach which is great. i would stay here again but definitely not in the rooms, i would just pay the extra for a villa.
title: beautiful pool and good location

text: We stayed here in September for a week with our 2 year old.  The staff were amazing and it was a friendly resort where it was easy to mix with other guests/families.  We stayed in the 1bedroom deluxe apartment which was spacious and modern but lacked a garden/outdoor space, was very dark inside and there were alot of mozzies. In saying that the staff sprayed the rooms every evening and put up mozzie nets after we requested. The location was fantastic, close to shops/beach and quiet. My husband got sick the end of our stay and the staff where incredible - Melda and the other Manager (sorry can't recall his name) were stars!
title: Fabulous location & great pool

text: This is my second stay after 3 years and we  booked this hotel because we did have an absolutely fantastic stay then . Sadly this  stay ( Room G-3) was not as memorable as the last one . While location wise it is perfect but the other benchmarks have fallen since my last visit. The rooms/furniture/linen looks dated and not maintained properly , house keeping is bad - dustbins/ash trays not cleaned , jacuzzi full of insects and quality of the breakfast is not the same anymore . The staff are friendly though but I feel the management needs to wake up !!
title: Good but deteriorating

text: Recently stayed at this hotel in the 1 Bedroom Villa with our own Jacuzzi which was just perfect (G3). Very quiet and relaxing with friendly staff.  Great location and central to all amenities with great food and bars.  Breakfast was freshly made and was excellent.  The only downfall was no tea and coffee facilities in the room and no kettle in the room to make your own coffee.  Apart from that, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would love to stay there again.  Perfect hideaway and would highly recommend.
title: Perfect Location !!

text: The staff was very friendly and helpful staff and the rooms were ample and the most important very clean! The location of the hotel is good, just 10 minutes walk from the beach. We had a great stay here and we would recommend it to family and friends.
title: Great Hotel

text:
Great Villa...stayed there 7 nights. Unit A1
 spacious with living area, sm kitchen big king bed ..great bath with tub and shower.  Friendly staff with a great small restaurant that serves a great breakfast. 10 min. walk with restaurants nearby.
One of nicest hotels I have stayed in for the price.
title: Hotel rating

text:
Our family of 4, including 2 teenagers, just returned from a 10 day stay at Artemis villas. It was everything we could wish for at a brilliant price. Great clean and comfy accommodation with a delicious breakfast thrown in for free. Easy walking distance to the surf at Seminyak beach, shops, restaurants and boutiques. Staff were very attentive, friendly and could not do enough for us. Pool was lovely and our 2 bedroom apartment was spacious and had everything we needed, including cooking facilities if you wanted a night in rather than eat at the villas restaurant or numerous local restaurants. Free wifi and a glorious pool kept the teenagers entertained and we could just relax in the lovely quiet gardens or villa courtyard when not at the beach.
We will definitely be back and wished we could have stayed for longer. If you wanted a trip to Kuta or anywhere transport was easily accessible or could be organised by the staff. If you want a great value, safe and secure stay with great staff in a top location, look no further.
Brilliant!!
title: Gem in Seminyak near everything

text:
Considering this hotel is in Seminyak, it is very quiet and peaceful.
The hotel grounds, rooms, pool and restaurant are all very nicely maintained and look beautiful, especially at night.
I stayed in a deluxe apartment which consisted of a kitchenette, living room, bedroom and outdoor bathroom. The majority of the apartment was very clean, with the exception of the bathroom, which could do with a good deep clean. The water pressure and temperature were excellent at all times though. The bed was the biggest I have ever seen, you could sleep about 6 people in it. Was like 2 kings pushed together.

The pool is beautiful, but there is only 6 loungers, but the majority of the pool is shaded from the sun at all times anyway. The only real let down of the hotel.

The hotel is located down a side street, away from the noise of Jl. Camplung Tanduk. The surrounding area has something for everyone. Seminyak/Double 6 beach is a 10minute walk to the left, past a few restuarants and minimarket. To the right there is a wide choice of restuarants, bars, shops and clubs.

The staff and cleaners were all lovely and friendly.
title: Peace and Luxury

text: We are half way through our stay at Artemis and we are really enjoying it. The staff are extremely nice and very helpful. Without us asking they organised a beautiful cake for our daughter her turned 10 today. The thing I like the best about Artemis is how quiet it is given that you are in the middle of Seminyak and 5 minutes from all the nice shops and restaurants. At night all we can hear is the quiet hum of the air-conditioner. For this reason alone we will definitely stay here next time we are in Bali. We only eat breakfast at the Villa and it has been perfect for us. It is not as lavish as what you might get in the big resorts but we still get a very nourishing and tasty hot breakfast. In the mornings the kids always spend an hour in the swimming pool and they have a great time. Then we usually go out and about. We have been staying in one of the Garden Villas and that has been perfect for two adults and two young kids (6 and 10). The only downside to our stay are the mosquitos. In the evenings we certainly need to apply plenty of repellant but I guess that is what you have to expect in the tropics.
title: Very happy at peaceful Artemis

text: The rooms are nice and the front desk staff are very good. The restaurant and its staff are quite poor. Breakfast can take ages to arrive. The last thing you really want to do is wait 20 minutes for your coffee in the morning! That seems like some kind of inhumane torture!! Otherwise a decent place in a convenient location.
title: Pretty good

text:
The hotel is located at the end of an alley away from the main street in Seminyak. You have to walk approx. 5 mins to get to the beach. On the main street you find many restaurants, spas and a supermarket.

The premises are small but well designed. There is a beautiful pool which has a very private feel to it. However, there aren't enough sun beds if the hotel is fully booked. There is an open bar by the pool where they serve breakfast, snacks and drinks. The entire location has a high-quality and well maintained feel.

We stayed in a garden villa. This consists of a private garden, two bedrooms, two en-suite bathrooms and a living area with sofa and kitchen. The bathrooms are semi-open and the bedrooms feature satellite TVs, A/C and mosquito nets. Overall the rooms are a little worn but clean.

Staff are very friendly. Especially the duty managers provide personal service and try their best to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

Breakfast is great. They offer a choices of Western, Japanese and Indonesian dishes from a a la carte menu. The juices are freshly made and you can create your own mix. I can recommend their Nasi Goreng and the Miso Soup.

I would choose Artemis again when I return to Bali. Definitely one of the more refined places in Seminyak. Come here if you like small hotels with a boutique feel, quiet surroundings in a central location, personal service and excellent breakfast.
title: Great location & staff

text: This place is great, it is 300 metres from the beach and in the middle of great restaurants, shopping, nightclubs and pubs at the same time. This place has rooms for every need, but we paid extra for the better pool villas and they were absolutely magic.
title: Tranquillity and comfort near the beach in Seminyak.

text:
An upgrade to a deluxe apartment was a nice addition to the welcome drink and refresher face towel upon arrival. Our apartment was clean, comfortable and spacious through out. The staff are welcoming, friendly and attentive to your needs, the restaurant staff were amazing with both the service and the meals.
 a good selection of breakfast options included in the room price.  I would happily stay at Artemis again.
title: Relaxing villas

text: We stayed in this hotel in May 2014, it was wonderful. The staff were so courteous and went out of there way to please us. Apartment itself was spotless and pool and poolside bar were amazing. The location is very good, it has plenty bars & restaurants near by, the Hotel itself is down a narrow side street so its not noisy from the street. WIFI connection was very poor, that was the only downturn.  Will be definitely returning here again.
title: Wonderful Stay

text:
We stayed there with my wife in May for one week in one bedroom villa which faced directly the pool. 
Villa was clean, comfortable, spacious with nice design inside. 
Location 10 minutes walk from the nearest beach and a bid "hidden" away from the main street. 
Artemis staff was very nice, helpful and friendly. 
Internet access was very poor there but do we really need to be online during vacations?:)
title: Artemis for one week

text: We spent 3 weeks in Bali moving between Nusa Lembongan, Ubud and Legian and we were very much looking forward to our stay at Artemis. And we were not disappointed. The room is a combination of modern and traditional design - high thatched roof, open air shower and modern fixtures with everything you need and want. The housekeeping and hospitality staff were very friendly and attentive - fresh towels in the evening and morning, turndown services and they even light the oil burner in the room if you are out - loved it. My only whim would be that on the website it states that free airport transfers (one way) is offered as a service. However when I went to book this I was told that this was only free if you booked directly through the Artemis website - not a huge issue but I would suggest that this needs to be updated on the website.
title: Nice Boutique Hotel

text:
We just arrived back. Artemis Villa Hotel was excellent, We can not fault anything about this place. 
We have been to Bali many , many times and we must say , this has been one of the best places we have stayed at. The Management & Staff are all very, very nice and nothing to them is a concern . 
The breakfast is very good, the pool area is great, the location is terrific.
 There is a range of different accommodation available, we were in a Hotel room and were after three days upgraded to an apartment at no additional charge-Nice! We also liked that this is not a huge party Hotel or Villa , it is very Quite and good for all age groups that respect a nice ambiance and wonderful surroundings. Thankyou Artemis Owner , Management and all staff . Craig and Ves
title: Great Place- we loved it!

text:
We stayed in a pool villa with 2 rooms.  The first villa we were shown to was gorgeous, with a great pool, very nice bedrooms and a really large comfortable living space.  Unfortunately there were construction works going on right above the villa which meant workmen overlooking the pool and really loud banging from early morning. We were moved to another villa were the noise was reduced, it wasn't quite as nice but it was still very good.

The general pool is also very nice and did not seem too busy, we spent our last day there, after we had checked out. The hotel also offers a good and reasonably priced massage menu which we took advantage of!

We have stayed in a few areas in Bali and, of the place on the coastline, I think I like Seminyak the best.- you have access to a great beach which isen't as busy as Kuta but still has the great waves for bodyboarding etc but you are also much closer to better bars and restaurants.  But we were there with regulars to the area so we benfited a lot from their knowledge!
title: great location, lovely rooms

text:
I stayed in a two bedroom pool villa with my partner and friends for a week during June. Artemis Villa was beautifully clean with crisp decor, comfortable beds and a lovely private pool. The location was great, only a short taxi ride or 15 min walk to the main restaurant strip, 5 min walk to beach and close to some great Seminyak shopping.

Although we had the private villa, there is also a fantastic communal pool and bar area if you want to socialise or eat breakfast with other guests.

But the best thing about Artemis Villa was the gorgeous staff, so friendly and accommodating. I'd defineitly stay here again.
title: When can I go back?

text:
We stayed there for 3 nights with my family in two "2-bedrooms pool villas" for my wedding ceremony in Bali.
In general, the villa is nicely decorated, though the air-con is not cool enough. The free wi-fi is only accessible near the common pool & restaurant, but they offer LAN cable so we can get online with my notebook. 
I feel a bit strange about the different design of the 2 bathrooms in the same villa. The nicer one with bath tub was situated in the bedroom with twin beds instead of in the the queen-bed's room.
As my husband and I were staying behind in another villa and were out for a diving trip, my family members did the check-out for us.  They asked the staff for the free airport transfer the day before they depart and were promised to be ok.  However, on the day of departure when waiting at the lobby, they were told that the "free-transfer" was not applicable since our villas were booked through Agoda.com. My sister then asked for the villa transfer service as the 6 of them could all be fitted into one van instead of calling 2 taxis, but the staff told my sister that they've already called 2 taxis for them and they're on their way so couldn't arrange the villa van for them!  After negotiating with the staff, the villa ended up paying for the 2 taxis to airport for my family.
The conclusion is that the staff needs more training. They're not unhelpful but well, not up to standard.

Tips: The alley to the villa is dark and narrow, remember to bring a touch along or you can hardly see the road at night!
title: Nice villa but service need to be improved!

text: We have just enjoyed a 5night stay in one of the 2 bed room garden villas with our 2 children. The villa was well proportioned and clean with nice furniture. The staff very friendly but also importantly, very helpful. Nothing was too much for them. The location is nice, you're 5min walk from seminyak beach and shops. The breakfast bar is located next to the pool and offers a good selection of food. The villa did not have wifi only cable, however when I asked, with in 5min a router was delivered and setup in our villa for wifi. Only negative was we had a real problem with Mosquitos. Our stay was in August and no matter what we tried, electronic, sprays, burners, repellent, our children we covered in bites, about 15-20!!. Our room had netting and seemed to be the only real protection where as theirs didn't. The staff we very helpful and apologetic. Having spoken to some of the other guests it seems its only the garden villas, where the bathrooms are open to the garden so nothing to stop them flying in, where as the other villas/rooms were totally enclosed. It could just also be the time of year and we were just unlucky. Still, a lovely place to stay just be ware!
title: Charming villa

text: What a gem, tucked out of site from the busy main drag, down a lane way, if I hadn't seen it on trip advisor I don't think I would have found it in Seminyak. Just like the internet pics......great decor, clean, modern, calming, very light!!!!! our room had white roman blinds, so the exterior lights of the complex shone through most of the night, and the morning light came through extensive windows, not that it bothered us in the morning. Not too sound proof,bathroom has an opening to back garden and adjoining guests bathroom so you can hear noisy guests in adjoining bathroom, but hey that wasnt too bad unless they came home early hrs of morning and she was a raving loud nagger with a gripe(i.e went on and on an on!!!! but only for 1/2 hr).... it just echoes), all the other guests were great, and as this was just a once off you put up with it.We were in a hotel room, very large, the Villa's are beautiful, the pool and gardens are too, and the staff treat you very individually and made you feel unique.
title: tucked away...............peaceful, yet close to the hub bub of Seminyak

text: We have been staying in a garden villa at Artemis with our two young children for 8 nights.  Have enjoyed it immensely.  Location is good for shopping, and a short walk to the beach.  I love the wal down to the pool, you feel like you are walking into paradise.  Rooms are very good, great kitchen facility.  Lots of staff to fulfill any need.  We are right at the pool and restaurant.  Did have to ask for music to be turned down one night as we could not sleep, but was done quickly.  Other reviews commented on limited breakfast which I thought would not worry me, but after 8 days of the same breakfast I am looking forward to a change.  Staff are fantastic, spa is heavenly.  Not an overly busy hotel and many villas have their own pools so we had the main pool to ourselves most of the time.
title: Great little oasis in seminyak

text: We loved our stay and recommended the hotel to all of your friends. The furniture is stunning, the bathroom amazing, the staff perfect... This is an excellent boutique hotel. Would definitely come back anytime!
title: We loved it! Such a beautiful place!

text:
This property was truly a gem, A little hidden away in Seminyak but only 5 mins walk to the beach. 

Beautifully decorated villas and well equipped with open air bathrooms. 

The staff was very nice and friendly. 

The breakfast was adequate.
title: Convinient, nice villas, good breakfast and service

text:
We stayed @ Artemis after scouring the internet for an amazing but affordable place to stay.. words cannot describe how perfect this place was. Every single staff member was extremely helpful, and you could tell that they enjoyed their work. Was such a relaxing vibe, the room was pristine, if i could design my own house from scratch it would be just like the artemis.

The Artemis has a greek feel, with gorgeous white wash everything, and amazing lush gardens. The pool is very clean, and although they were booked out, we almost always had the pool to ourselves (some of the villas have their own pools).

The food was yummy and always made quickly too!

One of the guys who worked there, whom i have forgotten his name (damn it!) looked after us the whole time we were there, he drove us everywhere we wanted for the 7 days we were there. You can organise this with them when you get there, just tell them youd like to organise a driver for your stay. its so much better than catching taxis everywhere and you get to know them and get a great insight into aspects of the culture.

For info, we booked online @ lastminute.com.au - they had great prices :)

Again.. fabulous stay, will definitely stay here again and always rave about it to our friends!

Thanks Artemis :)
title: Amazing, Tranquil, Absolutely Perfect

text:
We had never stayed in a resort-type accommodation before, and absolutely loved Artemis! The rooms are huge and very clean, and the pool area is very relaxing. Located down a quiet street and just a 5-10 minute walk from the beach. While you will probably be spending most of your time at the beach, hanging out by the peaceful pool was a welcome break from the crowds! We wished we could stay for longer, and hope to go back...highly recommended.
*Only problem was the mosquitoes - the bathrooms are open-air and we both got bitten several times throughout the night. Hope they can do something about this!
title: Luxurious

text: We stayed in the 3 bedrooms villas and it was all that we wanted it to be.  The sun was on the villa for most of the day.  The villa was huge, clean and all bedrooms have their own bathrooms.  I travelled with two girlfriends and there is plenty of room for three couples.  The location is great as it is a 2 mins walk off the main stripe so you are no on the main road.  There are shops in the street it is off and it is only a 5 min taxi to the main Seminyak strip…cost of about $2.  We did not use the main pool as we had the pool in the villa but the main pool area was lovely but did only have limited seating – 8 deck chairs.  Breakfast was included but was very basic, but fine.  Overall I would highly recommend the 3 bedroom villa to anyone wanting a very relaxing time in Bali.  Oh and don’t forget to take some lilos as they are perfect in the pool.
title: Perfect ....

text:
My 2 friends and I had a memorible stay at Artemis for the last week in December. I cant think of any negatives to write about as everything was positive.  The staff were all stars especially the boys and girls who cleaned and tidied our 3 bedroom villa morning and night. The reception staff went out of their way to be as helpful as possible.
Our villa was completely private with it's own pool and jacuzzi kept perfectly  clean by the 2 staff members who looked after all the pools at Artemis.
After a long search for the greatest place to stay in Seminyak, we have now found it ....
Artemis.
Must mention the perfect location of the villa, a few minutes walk to many restaurants, cafes, many shops etc.
Will certainly return at the earliest opportunity.
title: Everything was great!

text:
I booked us after searching endlessly for accommodations in Bali. All I knew was I wanted to book in Seminyak instead of Kuta because I wanted to be away from too much noise. That was a good decision, although Seminyak beach is some 10 minutes of walking.

The villa is smallish, but very homey. We booked what they call a hotel room, but by standard definitions, it is not a hotel room but an apartment - it's got a kitchen and living room and a bar that doubles as a dining table.  It is high-ceilinged, and the ceiling is thatched, from where hangs a ceiling fan. The bedroom is beautiful and the bathroom amazing.  The bathroom is al fresco, almost everything in stone.  The bathtub's stone and set on a bed of white stones as well.

Another nice feature - foliage.  Lots of it in the villa.  So the small pool and the lanai beside the pool are shaded by trees.  The pathways leading to the rooms are shaded as well.  very, very refreshing.  

Breakfast is standard fare, but not bad.

If any improvement is needed, the bedrooms should use a more powerful aircon.  Even if set 
to 17 degrees, it is cool but not cool enough, specially for a city that is situated almost on the equator.

Price is not bad. This is what took me long to search for a hotel in Bali that will fit my budget yet looked different and had most od the places we wanted to go to within reach.  Artemis fulfilled these requirements perfectly.  The villa made our first trip to Bali very memorable.
title: OASIS....

text: What a wonderful find.  Artemis was extremely well priced and located.   The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and spacious (they even turned down your beds at night).  We stayed in H1 (hotel room) at $90/night and A5 (apt room) at $150/night.  Unbelievable value for money.  Breakfast and transfers included/free wi-fi.  Simple breakfast of fruit, juice, coffee and a choice of full american, indo or jap.    Lovely grounds, very private and quiet.  The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly.  Small restaurant but very adequate and plenty of choice on the menu.   The pool was a good size for the complex - most days we were the only ones there.   We had a good look around at other villas/hotels in the area within the same price range and they didn't even come close to what you get at Artemis.  The only suggestion I would make to the hotel is that they improve the air conditioning units and have better window treatments in some of the rooms (to block out the morning sun).   I usually stay at the larger 5 star hotels and I was not disappointed at all with Artemis and would definitely stay again.
title: GREAT VALUE

text:
We stayed in one of the hotel rooms for a week and from the minute we were collected from the airport we were treated to Bali's famous hospitality and friendliness.  

The room was spacious and clean, the bed was huge, and we were even given an option to change the type pillow, which is a nice touch, but unnecessary as they were just right.  The bathroom was great, with a lovely inside/outside walk in shower and fresh towels daily.  They also left a little gift on the bed which was a lovely gesture. 

The pool area and restaurant / bar is beautifully finished and landscaped, a real oasis after a hot day exploring.  Everyday the breakfast was fresh and tasty and the staff all so friendly, which always gets the day off to a good start. 

We only wish we could of stayed longer.  All the staff were very helpful and we really felt like we were at home, among friends.  

On the last day, I mistakenly left some jewellery in the room, they rang as soon as they discovered them, and as we had just left for the airport 10 minutes before, they told us that someone was already on their way to meet us (in heavy traffic) to bring them . 

This place is for anyone looking for a peaceful relaxing retreat within easy reach of the great restaurants, bars and shopping in Seminyak, and only a 10 minute easy stroll to the beach.

We are already looking at planning our trip to Bali next year and will certainly be staying at Artemis again. 

Thank you 

Clare & George
title: Peaceful haven in beautiful, bustling Seminyak

text:
We stayed in Artemis in June 2010 for 4 days and loved the experience! We had booked a 2 bedroom garden villa but were upgraded to a 2 bedroom pool villa when we arrived. We were thrilled!
The rooms were very tastefully decorated and clean and the living room was perfect for 4 of us. The kitchen had everything we required in case we wanted to cook a meal ourselves, though we used it mainly for coffee and tea. And we spent a lot of time splashing around in our private pool. 
Breakfast was included in the tariff. While there wasn't a lavish buffet, the made to order breakfast was delicious and the service fairly responsive. 
Wifi was free and quite fast, much to my relief, as I need to be connected most of the time!
The hotel is in a narrow lane which is probably the only drawback and you could miss it if you didnt know where it was. The walk to the beach is about 10 mins. It's also close to lots of massage parlours, lovely restaurants and pubs - would recommend Santa Fe for the great food, ambience and lively music with it. The Delicious Onion is also about a 7 min walk from the hotel. 
 It makes sense to hire a bike - makes it easier to get around Seminyak and Kuta and not constantly have to pay for cabs - though they are very economical.
The hotel can also provide a car and driver for sightseeing. We hired Puttu for a day when we travelled to Ubud and he was very helpful and even took us to a lovely art gallery to buy paintings. 
I would definitely recommend Artemis to anyone looking for a peaceful and beautiful retreat in Seminyak. We're definitely staying there the next time we're in Bali!
title: A real gem!

photos.caption: The Seminyak beach near the hotel
Another view of the living room. Very spacious and tastefully done.

text: We stayed two nights in a garden villa. The room was new and clean  and it had a little pretty garden. I have to say the service needs to be strengthened. We had to wait more than forty minutes to have breakfast. When we complained, the worker repeated excuses without sincerely apologizing. When we called a taxi, the receptionist didn`t tell us anything although the taxi already arrived and waited for us more than 20 minutes. I know other hotels and villas with better service and facilities in Bali and it doesn`t make sense to stay in this villa with that level of service and the price.
title: Poor Service - you can find better places with better value.

text:
nice little resort in the heart of semanyak !

We stayed in a Villa, had our own private jaccuzi. Rooms are spacious, and well kept. Near the beach [10 minutes walking]

The staff is very friendly, and will help you at all times. Free wifi and an aircon Internet room with 2 desktops. 

Only 6 beds by the pool.
title: good !

text: My daughter and I stayed at Artemis Villa and Hotel for a week in June. After reading some mixed reviews we weren't sure what we would find, but it was just such a lovely place to stay. The staff were so friendly and went out of their way to help.  We stayed in the 'hotel' style room and it was perfect for the two of us. The bathroom was spacious and very clean.The only complaint that I have is that the room was rather light in the morning, so I suggest you take an eye mask. The beds were very comfortable.The pool area was lovely and so was the restaurant. I went to Java for a week and then came back to Artemis for one night before leaving Bali. It was like I was coming home, with all the staff greeting me like an old friend. It is a wonderful place to stay, as being far from a main road it is so quiet. We would love to stay there again.
title: Like coming home

text:
I stayed here in a 2 bedroom garden villa with my 2 teenage daughters for 6 days and for the price and location it suited us just fine. 

If you are looking for a big pool and party scene this is not the place. It is more about being able to relax around a very pretty pool with the option of OK food and very attentive staff. The villas are of a good size but as is typical of the Balinese building rush, the finish wouldn't cut it in Australia. 

The lane in, that some reviewers found too long, we found added to the seclusion and quietness. Everything is close by up the lane and taxi hopping is an easy way to get further around. 

Their spa alternates between a very competent traditional massage to one that should have been deemed a practice by a sweet but inexperienced young girl. go to Jari Menari if you want a serious massage.

If you want to stay in Seminyak but find that you need some down time from the madness - especially during Australian school holidays  - then this is a good option. 

Just remember this is Bali, a place where a smile, a few kind words and a more tolerant and giving way  fix most problems.
title: Reasonable price villa hidden down a quiet lane in bustling Seminyak

text: MY FAVORITE PLACE !! Loving the stylish villas in greek style Very spacious stayed in 3 of them already as I went back 3-times !! Great location and Well hidden too !!! Fantastic bathrooms !! Nice Smiley Friendly Happy Service very helpful make your stay very Pleasant & Comfortable !! And Always get a Good baby Sleep & Beauty Sleep there on their huge Comfy Beds !!!! We brought a friend With us the third time we came and He loved it too !!
title: My OTHER SWEET SWEET HOME !!!!

text: The villa is very clean and green, almost like a sanctuary in the heart of seminyak. Great pool, a lil small though. The villa is thoughtfully designed, spacious and equipped with rain shower. What we didn't like will be the long narrow walk in/out of the villa to the main street, even though it's only 10-15min walk to the beach.
title: The villa is very clean and green, almost...

text:
We arrived in Bali at Artemis from Kuala Lumpur, and it was just amazing. Peaceful, and we we're so impressed by the design in the studio apartment we rented. The bathroom was lovely, and the bed - I wanted to bring it back home. The resort wasn't finished when we stayed there, so it was some noise during daytime, however, all in all we just had an incredible stay. As we were some of the first guest, we almost got too much attention from the staff, they were kind of everywhere (although that seems a bit rude to complain about that, as well as I guess they were excited about the opening). Fresh and healthy breakfast. Liked the simpleness of the place, additionally, it had a scent of luxury. 

Also, we booked a daytrip with the driver at Artemis. It did cost us a bit more than some other options, but he's very friendly and we had many interesting conversations with him. We obviously did a bargain, I guess the prices are much higher now.
title: Magical place

text:
Stayed for 11 nites March 2010,Have been to Bali 15+ times and stayed at various places. Hotel Resort only open since Dec 2009 so all is still new.
Staff are pleasant and helpfull. Stayed in a hotel room which was very roomy and had a kingsize plus bed withTV + DVD/CD player, fridge and safe. Good size bathroom with large shower and seperate bath and toilet had bidedt wand. Room was airconditioned plus had an overhead fan.  Hotel is located in a laneway off Jl Dhyanaputa and a short stroll from the beach. Close to restaurants, supermarket, shops, Spas and night life.Inhouse restaurant does Indonesian, Japanese + Western meals.
Inhouse restaurant staff could do with a little more experience. Would go back again.
Btw usually go to Bali between July + Sept and found the heat and humidity in March somewhat uncomfortable.
title: RECOMMENDED

text: Stayed here for two nights in March 2010. Didn't book before and just arrived - got a room with pool view for 650k, pretty good value. Rooms were stunning, all blue and bleached woods. Bathroom is outside and is one of the nicest I've ever seen - big limestone bath and rain shower. I'm really fussy but the  pool area is beautiful. Clean lines, great beds and lovely atmosphere. For the price it's good value. It's deffo a 3 or 4 star only, with better than average rooms. The bale next to the pool is gorgeous but the service throughout is a bit weak. Everyone is nice but English isn't great. I ordered breakfast with two plain fried eggs and they brought it with a scrambled egg. When I sent it back and explained it came back with two fried eggs and toast but then no bacon or tomato! I couldn't be bothered arguing. I'd definitely stay again if I could get a good price. Gardens are beautiful too.
title: Beautiful design but service a bit sketchy

text:
I stayed here 1 night and got a free upgrade to the Jacuzzi villa - and at a good price.  Intended to come back for 10 nights but some issues really put me off.

The good:
- Nice and clean and new
- Really fast free wifi
- Good cocktails at a good price
- Great bed
- Good location (except the driveway)
- Pleasant staff
- Nice candles and aromotherapy in room.

The bad:
- the jacuzzi in my villa had a very very bright light that shone directly into the bedroom and they couldn't turn it off
- terrible aircon - not enough in the bedroom and none in the separate lounge area that was like an oven.  They close it up at night and the floor is, quite literally, hot to walk on (way beyond warm)
- no free water in the room and they charged like 5 times the shop price for Aqua
- very average breakie.  Cold noddles that are supposed to heat on the candle underneath
- small pool - and there were guests in it drinking and smoking while in the pool
- terrible access down the lane (very very narrow)
- needed a good clean up after construction.  Builders grit in the shower etc.

Full price here would be a joke given other places like the Kunja etc.  However, if they fix the above issues and you can get a discount then try it out - but don't book a full stay here (yet).  Also, if it was even half full it would be very very crowded.
title: Could be great but...

text:
Having never been to Bali I can't compare it to other hotels.  We came with our one year old and they were very accommodating of the little one.  It is a small hotel with most rooms facing or very near the pool area.  This was great for us during the baby's naptime as we could pop out for a swim.  The pool area os lovely, a nice size and often feels like it is there just for us.  

The one bedroom apartment is fine for our needs, the bed is huge but that is because it is 2 double beds pushed together so they can take them apart for people wanting two beds.  I must agree with the other reviewer that the pillows are a bit high and firm but I imagine that is because they are still new.  

Breakfast is just fine and we had some lunch snacks that were nice as well.  My only complaint would be the air conditioning unit is not big enough for the villa.  It cools the bedroom but not really the lounge room and I needed a break from the heat.  The bathroom is open so there is no air conditioning in there and while it looks really nice I couldn't see myself relaxing in the bathtub when there is a nice pool just outside my door.  We didn't have a problem with mosquitos but they do provide coils and spray in the room if you need it.  The shower was fine, no flooding for us and our baby loved all the stones surrounding the bathtub!

Also, there is a nice spa just up the road, which I took advantage of most days!  We never even walked down to the beach, didn't see the point.
title: A nice quiet retreat within walking distance to shops and restaurants

text:
Positive points: good price, the pool is large and nice, the staff super friendly, the location is close to the beach and there were good restaurants options around. 
But the hotel has suffered a lot from the covid crisis: the closet door was broken, the A/C was running but it was always warm, water was out for a few hours and without any warning (which isn’t funny when you are waging your hair…)
Also the drivers were always getting lost trying to find the place, really narrow streets and their restaurant wasn’t functioning at all (but also did not offer other alternatives, eg. ordering take outs for their guests…)
title: Old, needs renovation

owner_response.text: We apologize for the inconvenience. The room has been renovated. Please come again.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This place is hard to get to, narrow entrance and service isnt that great. First night I had bed bug bites. They changed linens and sprayed no other problems. The pool is nice but the staff does not clean well. Very limited car parking so ride a bike or u wont have a place to park. The water is very poor, rust ur razor after one shave. Otherwise its a quite place but it about all thats good here. If u start ur car at night the owner will complain even if the car is quiet. Many better places to stay in Bali and I am looking for them. Utopic is a much better place to stay.
title: Artemis Hotels and Villas

owner_response.text: We apologize for the inconvenience caused due to the corona crisis. The renovation work has been completed, so please come again.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My partner and I just spent a week here. 
It’s an oasis in the middle of crazy. 
A small walk down a well lit gang off the Main Street to get to the hotel. 
Very quiet. Beautiful pool and gardens. 
We stayed in apartment A3. 
Our small terrace looked over the pool. 
The apartment was clean and tidy and well equipped. 
Breakfast was included in price, a plus!
Staff were super friendly. 
We would highly recommend this hotel.
title: QUIET PARADISE

text:
We had a booking for 5 nights with 2 bedroom garden villa. I was travelling with my parents, husband and my 6months old baby. We checked in late evening and as soon as we entered the villa, we realised that there are spider nets. The house keeping cleaned it when we pointed it but that was just the beginning! After a while i checked the bathroom. It was dark, Full of stains, floor not clean, spiders and mosquitos inside and a stale smell. We thought of sleeping the night as it was too late.
Next day first thing I went to inform the receptionist. He offered to upgrade the villa with some extra charge. We checked the villa and it was better than this one. We accepted and they started making the villa for us. Not just that, they even offered to view the villa multiple times for our peace of mind. 
I was quite happy that atleast they are trying. When everything confirmed, I called the reception to ask them to transfer our luggage. And thats when he says “sorry the villa has been booked by someone else and we need to cancel your request”. It pissed me to the utmost level. Had a big argument and they offered me to move to another villa for 3 nights and then i will have to move back to my original villa on 4th night. This pissed me even more. Not just idiots, these people have zero curtesy that how will someone who is with an infant, make so many moves! 
That was it! I decided to move to another property ‘Le Jardon’. Please look for my review for that.
Artemis is zero kid friendly and not for people who likes good service
Cleanliness- 1/5
Kid friendly - 0/5
Breakfast - 1/5
Value for money - 0/5
Service - 0/5
title: Beyond pathetic!

text:
This is a very nice small hotel. Rooms (and mattresses) could do with a refresh (especially the bathrooms where the mosquito netting is just nailed to the windows). 

Breakfast is cooked to order. It is good and of average size. Good for me, but might too small for a large appetite. 

The hotel sits quite far from the street so the rooms are exceptionally quiet, even outside. You cannot hear the clubs on JI.Camplung Tanduk even when you stand outside. 

Please note that JI.Camplung Tanduk is the main gay nightlife area in Bali. I didn't know this when I booked. If you are looking for that, this is probably a great choice. I ended up changing hotels to be closer to the traditional nightlife. 

Finally note that the main photo (currently a blue sofa with four stools under an arched staircase by a pool) here, and on all of the booking sites, turns out to be a specific large villa room. You will not see that area unless you book that room. I thought it was a bit misleading to have one specific room as the lead photo and would urge the hotel to use a more appropriate lead picture.
title: Nice Place in the Main Gay Nightlife Area of Bali

text: The villa is very hidden. We stayed for 4 nights in the 3-Bedroom with Pool suite. The pool is nice and the living room is very roomy with kitchen area. However, we never did use the kitchen for cooking. Our biggest complaint is the mosquitoes in the area and no AC in the living room. The living room has opening to the outside areas so when you turned the lights on at night, all these blood sucking insects swamped our suite. Artemis did provide insect repellent and it did help. I guess this is the price we pay to stay in villa. This happens in every villa in Bali! Once we shut the door and spread the mosquito net at night, we slept well though. The staff is super awesome and the location is great - only 15 minutes from Double Six beach. If you need to go elsewhere you can have them call Blue Bird taxi for you. Overall, this is a good place and location.
title: Great Breakfast!

text:
Down a well lit side street this accommodation is excellent quality, quiet and accommodating.  There are villas with private pools and rooms  around  a central pool. We had 1 bed villa with jacuzzi pool which was beautiful and private, but you could also  use the main pool and take meals in restaurant or your villa. 
There was a problem with our pool after a massive storm and were were moved to a 2 bed villa with large pool. This was  equally well furnished and a real treat. 
Breakfast choices are many from Continental, American/English to Indonesian, Japanese and  Mexican. 
All staff are genuinely friendly.
Recommend staying here as only a  short walk to Seminyak  beach and  plenty of shops and restaurants close, but a quiet oasis to escape to  .
title: Lovely accomodation, friendly staff

text:
This is not my first visit to Seminyak.
The Artemis Villa locates in Seminyak, Kuta,was our next accommodation for our recent family summer holidays.
The only guy at the Front Desk small lobby,  as well as the security staffs.are very attentive and friendly,
Our Villa is beautifully decorated, spacious, high ceiling and with extra bathroom upstair. It has a beautiful private swimming Pool, with a small Pool adjacent to it which they called a Jacuzzi. We did enjoy swimming at the Pool as they cleaned it every days.
The location is good, nearby all the shops, local Spas, and Restaurants, and a long walk to the beach.
However, during our stay, we have encountered multiple Earthquakes which too much for one week time.
Nevertheless, I have checked that Artemis Villa have received quiet good rating from their Guests.But something very important is missing from their reviews.

As far as the beautiful Villa Artemis is concerned, mosquitos are the most annoying insects which included in it. In the evenings the Geckos are everywhere inside the Villa, making loud squeaking noises which sometimes freaking us out.
The Gate to enter our Villa sometimes opened by itself.
My Bathroom which has a half full-sized door to the Garden/Pool. is connected to the Bedroom. I have noticed that some creatures always entered into my bathroom and left its feces behind.
I informed the Housekeeping persons verbally several times, to pour on some Chlorides powder along under the door, to prevent those creatures entering the bathroom. They kept saying 'yes, we will do it', but they never did, until I made my complaint in writing two days before we left.

We ate every mornings the variety of breakfasts served at the open hall Restaurant.
And I strongly believe that the staffs working there are not local, 
First, they never ever come to greet the Guests like most local Baliness. 
Most of the times they're standing and chatting next to the Bar adjacent to the Kitchen.
You need to waive and calliing them for getting your breakfasts, especially for your morning Coffees. Where is the Balinesse charms and hospitality? I missed it here.

From Seminak, we supposed to fly to Lombok. Due to the Earthquakes hit Lombok at that time, we had to cancel our trip..
We intended to prolong our stay here at Artemis, but then decided to move out and stay at another Hotel with rooms free of Mosquitos.
title: Beautiful Villa with imperfection of service

text: Located off a main area of shops and restaurants, but in a quiet lane. A choice of private villas or hotel accommodation. I choose a one bed villa, it was huge, with a separate lounge/dining/kitchen, and a small pool for cooling off. My gate could be locked for privacy, and outside the gate was the hotel complex with large pool, bar and restaurant, so this place has everything you need. There is a 24/7 reception area, and I had a minor accident late one night and they were excellent in looking after me and making sure I was patched up together again. I stayed for 5 nights and had two other hotels to go to afterwards, but wished I had stayed at Artemis my whole holiday.
title: Hidden gem

text: My boyfriend and me stood there for 9 nights rented the pool villa. We had an awesome stay there, privacy, clean room every day, the staff is very nice and helpful for anything you need. When we arrived there was no blender in the kitchen and no hair dryer, I asked one of the staff members and 10min later they brought both items into our room. We both love eating so we thought that the breakfast since it was a la cart it wouldn't satisfy us (we prefer buffets) but we were wrong, we had fool bellys every morning😊. The only reason I can't give the 5 stars is due to the bathroom presentation, it has a very dirty look even dou we figured since the first day that it is not dirt, it is from the water but we strongly recommend the hotel to find a product to deep clean the bathrooms since it just looks ugly, attached pictures of how we received the it the first day. But look, not everything is perfect! I would definitely stay there again.
title: Nice place, I can recommend.

text: I live in Perth Australia and have an intense job. When I have needed a few days of self nurturing the Artemis has always been perfect. The small hotel has a mix of rooms, apartments and villa with pools. I have always chosen an apartment as they look directly on to the main hotel pool and restaurant. The pool is beautiful and most often only one or two other travellers. As a woman travelling solo the Artemis also feels extremely safe. The staff are efficient and welcoming. Lastly this hotel is prrfectly situated between the beach, legian and seminyak - spa bali around the corner is very professional and many interesting fashion options snd restaurants are a walk away on jalan legian. Highly recommended.
title: Best boutique hotel in Seminyak

text:
This hotel isn’t fantastic but the money you are paying I enjoyed my 4 nights there. Seminyak is pretty expensive .
The staff are friendly and it’s in a decent location near double six beach. 
Only things I could say they need to improve on is that 
There are tons of mosquitoes around as well so with open air toilets there were plenty of them in my villa and probably as with most places in seminyak some furry little things running in between the shrubs which put me off eating there
title: Not a bad hotel

text: Hubby and I were recommended by a friend and we were not disappointed. Clean rooms, friendly staff and a lovely pool. We just had the hotel room. It was a good size and had a semi outside bathroom. We found the bed too soft though, I think our mattress was due to for replacement, when we sat on the bed the side collapsed. Great location 5 mins from the beach if you go down the gang to to the right and a couple of minutes from all the shops and restaurants. Breaky was good, not a buffet but set menus - ample food though. Some nice touches like extra towels at night and when there had been a sprinkle of rain we found that staff had lit mozzie coils in our bathroom. My only problem was if you like to lie in the sun, there's only about 2 lounges so sometimes I had to wait until they were available. There are only 6 in total but I understand that some villas here have their own pool. Great value boutique hotel.
title: Lovely little hotel

text:
We have stayed at the Artemis quite a few times over the past few years. It is peaceful and has a lovely ambience. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. One of the best things about this place is it's location. It is located close to a street with everything - shops, massage, restaurants. 
Stay if you like a smaller place with a quiet feel, close to everything you need.
title: Relaxing hideaway close to a great street

text: We are staying st Artemis hotel and villas for ten days.  The location is good, room is good although shower could be cleaner.   Breakfast is very average.  However we picked this hotel because it was small and we thought it would be fairly quiet which it was for a couple of days until this family moved in with kids who were loud, jumping back flipping screaming at the pool.  The walls of the rooms are paper thin so even with all the doors shut and the tv on you could still here them.  What was a serene setting turned into a permanent headache even though there are pool rules management take no notice.  Selfish .
title: Boutique hotel

text:
My wife booked this Villa room and it did not disappoint. Spacious and clean rooms. Comfy bed. Nice pool and great Japanese breakfast option. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
My only gripe would be the small TV but the DVD player was a bonus (I had flu and was resting up so I was room bound).
Not far to the beach or the main drag back to Kuta. Real value for money. Arigato!
title: Quite retreat off the main drag

text: We stayed in the resorts Joglo, the wooden home. It was so clean and spacious, we loved the vibe of the place. The private yard was a bonus as we had our 1 year old and 11 year old with us. The other great appeal was not having a pool by our accommodation because of the baby, but we had full access to the hotel pool, which had excellent bar service by the pool. The grounds are very cozy and comfortable. We were very happy with our stay here!
title: Family fun

text: We stayed in the "H" wing, so probably the smallest huts- they were still very large and clean. Slightly showing some dating and the showers with calcium build up and stained tiles- but nothing bad. Firm/ very firm bed, but most in Bali are that way I found. The pool is lovely and continental breakfast has different options and eggs which were perfect. Location is off the Main Street and away from road noise but 5min walk to the beach and shops in abundance. There are tons of hotels to chose from, this has good value for money. The tiles on the grounds around the pool are very slippery when wet, so be careful.
title: Good Seminyak Choice

text: What a gem! right in the heart of Seminyak, beautiful hotel, great pool, nice breakfast. Our 'bungalow/room' was great, only down side was the bathroom was tired. saying that, it was spotless, as was the room. The swimming pool is beautiful, and you are 2minutes from town. 5mins to the beach.I would recommend this hotel highly! The staff, (especially the manager) are fantastic, nothing too much trouble. prices reasonable. A peaceful retreat
title: absolutely loved it! Town centre location 5mins to beach

text: 2nd time stating here, didn't disappoint! Great breakfast cooked to order with fresh fruit & juices. Great quiet oasis but close to beach and shopping in Seminyak & funny drag bars just a few minutes away on the main street, fabulous pool & very nice friendly staff
title: Lovely & tranquil in great location

photos.caption: Fab place to stay, great brekkie & location
Fab place to stay, great brekkie & location

text: Absolutely love this place! So much so that I am writing a review before I have left!  It is very close to the beach and 5mins walk from main shopping hub.  So quiet and beautifully done with the biggest king size bed I have ever slept in!  Staff are beyond wonderful & helpful & this is definitely worth every penny.  Great location, beautiful surroundings & accommodation, I would definitely come back here!
title: A hidden little GEM!

text:
Let me start off by saying that the employees were very nice. The free breakfast was also ok. 

I had planned to stay 3 nights with my wife. We usually aren’t very picky about the hotel and wanted something close the the beach that was cheap. This place was around $70 us a night. 

The first day/first night… we got to our room, turned on lights and 5 min. later the power went out for our room only. I went to the front desk to let them know, they came and flipped the breaker for the room and power was back on. Then after coming back from dinner the power was off again. I got someone again who flipped the breaker again and then told us not to use the hot water because that might cause the power to go out…. I then asked for a different room and we were moved no problem. 

The second day/second night… was ok besides getting shorted 1000rp - 10,000rp by the kitchen a few times. I didn’t really care because that is only $0.10 - $1. But I would rather have the option of giving that as a tip than just being shorted without acknowledgment. 

The third day (NO THIRD NIGHT)… there was something wrong  with the septic tank and we had to step in what looked and smelled like human poop on the walk from our room to the main entrance/exit. Then at around 5pm we were in our room relaxing after a day of walking around and the front desk called and said they were going to be doing something and we could stay in our room for a bit or wait at the front desk. I had a hard time understanding what he was saying, it sounded like he said “we will be blowing” which I thought meant something along the lines of a leaf blower stirring up some dust. So I said we would stay in our room. They then came by the room and said to stay inside and put towels down at the base of the door. Then they turned on a motor and fog began to spew out. Turns out he was saying “we will be fogging” not “we will be blowing”. This is an insecticide/pesticide that they spray to keep mosquitoes away. 

AS OUR ROOM BEGAN TO FILL WITH POISON I told my pregnant wife to get under the bed covers so she wouldn’t breathe it in. This is an OPEN AIR ROOM, the ceiling is open and the bathroom has uncovered windows so the little towels they put down at the base of the door did absolutely nothing to keep the fog out. We were located in the very back of the hotel which is where they started fogging. So if we were to leave the room we would have to walk directly through the freshly sprayed path. We tried to get under the bed covers to help filter the air. I attempted to call the front desk and tell them that we could not breathe in our room and needed them to stop fogging so we could get out. Our room was filled with fog, I started feeling light headed and my chest was hurting. After the fog outside started to clear we grabbed towels to wrap around our face so that we could run out of the hotel. As we ran out all of the hotel employees were outside the hotel, the fogger was wearing a protective gas mask. We got far away from the hotel and sat down on the street curb, spitting and coughing. I was very worried for our health and the health of our baby. 

At this point we decided just to pack our bags and find a different hotel for the night. We gave the fog an hour to clear out, then went back to our room, quickly packed our things and headed to the front desk to check out. Even after an hour our open air room still smelled the insecticide/pesticide. They offered to give us a different room. They could NOT give us a refund but I didn’t care at that point I just wanted to GET OUT. We walked to a different hotel that was nearby and got a room. 

It is completely unacceptable to fog with people in these open air rooms. This is very unhealthy. I understand he attempted to communicate that they will be fogging but the thick accent was hard to understand and I did not know what fogging was until this happened. I know now that it’s a common thing to do in this part of the world and it probably isn’t unhealthy if you’re standing far way like the hotel employees were. But it is most definitely not healthy to be around when you’re in a closed space. The fog came into our room and filled it. The hotel should notify all guests that this is happening and tell them they MUST leave their rooms for a short period of time. 

The next few days I experienced minor symptoms of over exposure to insecticides/pesticides.
title: AS OUR ROOM BEGAN TO FILL WITH POISON...

text:
Where do I start ???
The staff are amazing & nothing was ever too much trouble.
Restaurant served up great pizzas & pool side snacks along with breakfast lunch & dinner menus to satisfy every taste. 
We stayed in an apartment & found it clean, comfy & quiet....our friends had villas & had no complaints. 
Pool & garden area was beautiful & always spotless.
Spa salon was excellent although a tad expensive.
Live acoustic singer 2 or 3 times a week was brilliant.
Such a charming & relaxing place tucked away down the back of   a gang amongst the hustle & bustle of Seminyak.
Walking distance to beach, bars, Bintang supermarket & Seminyak market.
Would certainly stay here again ....
title: Fantastic Place to stay .....

text: When we were taken to our room I thought it was the wrong one and that we must have been upgraded. It was gorgeous with a small living area, separate bedroom and huge bathroom and a step out the door to the pool. We simply loved it. It was so peaceful and very quiet at night. Breakfast was lovely and you ordered to your choice each morning. The hotel is down a laneway and when we drove in first I was thinking..oh crap but it took all of a minute to walk and it was well lit up at night. The gardens were delightful and well attended. Wifi was good..most of the time! There is only one comment I can make that is not so complimentary and that is about the bed. It is the biggest bed I have ever seen and comfortable but it has a wide wooden boarder on both sides which looks nice but is totally impractical and makes it hard to get in and out of. The only way was to crawl in from the end of the bed. Bit annoying really and maybe the wooden bit should be removed. An older person would have trouble with the bed. And the pillows were bad but we asked for extras which were supplied immediately. It was a 10 minute walk down to the beach and when you walked out onto the street there were shops and restaurants galore. I would stay at this hotel again it was great.
title: Peaceful stay

text:
I have a simple criteria for ranking hotels: a) staff friendliness, b) cleanliness, c) bed quality, d) breakfast coffee quality, and e) wow factor.  A point for each item.

I grade Artemis as follows: a) staff were friendly and helpful - 1 point; b) cleanliness okay, but my daughter received a lot of ant bites suggesting insect control poor - 1/2 point; c) bed and pillow quality were terrible, my wife and I both slept terribly - 0 points; d) coffee was terrible - 0 points; e) place was okay but no wow factor, it felt very cramped - 0 points.  

So 1 1/2 points it is.
title: Friendly but fails to deliver

text: I needed to just stop after a crazy busy six months. This was my fifth stay at Artemis Villas.  From Nengah (one of the senior staff) recognising and calling out to me over the heads of the hundred of greeters at the airport, cool towel at the hotel, lovely apartment room three steps from the pool, delicious breakfast cooked to order....what's not to love? My shoulders had dropped by the end of the first day. The location is great - just close enough to the rest of Seminyak (restaurants, shops etc etc), a five minute walk to the beach and a three minute walk to Spa Bali (great spa). By day seven I felt recalibrated- relaxed, smiling, healthy. Also perfect for sole female travellers, feels extremely safe. Cant wait to go back in a few months.
title: Kept wondering if I was in heaven!

text: We loved it here, staff are super friendly & helpful. Good free brekkie with fresh made juices. Will organise a driver for tours at a reasonable price. Lovely pool & outdoor breakfast room. We had a a small kitchen, lounge and separate bedroom. The bathroom was a bit dated but for the price was fine, plenty of hot water & even a stone bath. 10 mins stroll to the beach, a few mins to funny lady boy bars & loads of choice for restaurants. A great place to stay in Seminyak
title: Great location, away from hustle & bustle but close to beach

text:
First stay in Bali while, with kind support  by hotel staff and guide, I enjoyed much more than I expected.
Reasons to stay Artemis:
- High cost performance: large and cozy room. Clean. Appropriate amenity service. Good food and relaxing moment at a nice restaurant and pool-side.
- Quiet location: quiet because it is the end of a small alley while it takes just a minute to get to the center of Seminyak. 5 minutes to beach.
- Great staff: appreciated so much the reception lady who helped me a lot when I had questions and problems, and a guide person who brought me to many interesting places in Ubud.

初めてのバリで、右も左もわかりませんでしたが、ホテルのスタッフやガイドのヘルプで、最高に楽しい滞在になりました。
ベッドルームとリビングが分かれている、とても広いお部屋でした。キッチンも大きな冷蔵庫も、食器等もそろっていて、ロングステイにも向いてます。バスルームが広かった！広いだけでなく、設備もしっかりしていて、お部屋の雰囲気もcozyで、居心地がよいです。
プールサイドでくつろぐ時間がとてもよかったです。メインストリートから少し路地を入ったところにあるので、繁華街から近いにも関わらず、風の音しか聞こえないくらい静かでした。
次もまた泊まりたい、と思えるホテルです。
title: First and best stay in Seminyak

text:
The hotel is tucked away from the main street, providing privacy and relaxing atmosphere. We booked the 2 bedrooms villa with private swimming pool. Our kids loved it, and they spent hours swimming and playing in it. Although a bit old, our villa was very clean, and roomy. 
The breakfast was nice, and we loved the attentive attention we got from the restaurant manager. He was very friendly, personally greeted every guest, talking and making sure our food and needs are being met. 
The wifi was a bit slow, but hey, the more reason to relax and detached ourself from outside world.
title: Quaint boutique hotel

text:
In general nice rooms in a quiet location close to beach and main shopping street (5 mins walking distance). Nevertheless the service in the hotel was not satisfying at all. 
- WiFi did not work the whole stay (3 days)
- staff was not helpfull
- room was not ready at first night so we had to move to a smaller one
- recommended trips were not organized very well and too expansive (e.g., had to wait one hour for the bus transfer)
title: Good room, location ok, bad service

text:
We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and booked a studio appartment.
 
+
- walking distance from the beach (7 min)
- very close to all the restaurants and shops (1 min)
- good (a la carte) breakfast
- beautiful quiet swimming pool with all day sun and shade options
- nice staff (who adress you by name)
- big rooms

-
- a bit worn down bathroom that needs remodelling
- when paying full price (instead of a Agoda discount as we did) perhaps a tat overpriced (mainly due to the state of the bathroom and design of the room)

In conclusion, a nice hotel with a beautiful pool for discovering Seminyak.
title: Good hotel at Seminyak center

text: We stayed at 3 bedroom villa with private pool for 3 nights. Breakfast was good, although the employees tend to forget to pick up bfast request and we almost missed our bfast every morning. Our main bedroom gets hot easily cos the ceiling was up high and the HK always turns the AC off after cleaning our room. The first two nights, we couldnt sleep well due to heat and mosquitos. The pool was amazing. The front desk staff was friendly. Location is good: close to the beach, restaurants, and shops. The place needs an update amenity: the internet was a joke, the shower near the public pool looks run down. Library and business center needs a better faster internet, new computer and printer.
title: Love the location, not so love the attitude

text:
Check in many times, returned several times, still fall in love with this Villa, very friendly staff, like a family brothers and sisters. 
Walk along from the main street into the Villa, it like walking into a oasis place for quiet moment. Every villa has they own pool, therefore the main pool very peaceful. Little bit overprice, but hopefully could provide the coffee and tea facilities in the room. 
Sometime need a hot water for drink, but no kettle in the hotel room. 
Great breakfast and great services. Excellent.
title: Always is the oasis and tranquility place to Stay

text: I had such a great experience the first time at artemis, i wanted to stay there again and this time with my wife. both of us enjoyed our stay. we had the exact same room as 3 years ago and the property is well managed and kept. the service is great too. location ensures you are not on a busy street yet close to it when you need it. would highly recommend any family or couples. the rooms have the largest beds i have ever seen. The breakfast is a la carte which is good for this size of property as I dont like eating stale cold soggy buffets in other similar resorts.
title: second visit...still love it

text:
This little cozy hotel has a great location close to all shops, restaurants and not far from the beach too, with the advantage of the quietness being situated at the end of a small hallway 50m away from the main road. 
My room was spacious, clean very well decorated, maybe only the bathroom was lacking some charme.
The pool area where the restaurant is located (excellent breakfast with choice between American, Continental, Indonesian or Japanes) is clean and quiet. A billard table was available for the guests and great live music at night (I actually played with the singer before his performance, such a relaxed and cool atmosphere)
Staff extremely friendly and helpful, great massage (booked a package including free 30 mins session)
Very recommendable place to stay in Seminyak!!
title: Great location, excellent value for money

text:
The Artemis Villa and Hotel was our first stop on our Bali adventure. What a wonderful place to begin. 

This hotel has a great location close to shops, restaurants and the beach. 

The Villas are spacious and clean.  The pool is clean and quiet.  Breakfast was lovely both in our villa and by the pool. 

Staff was friendly and helpful.  I would recommend the Artemis.
title: Great location

owner_response.text:
Dear  LW,

Firstly, thank you for your good reviews which has sent to Tripadvisor.
And also thank you  for  your stay with us at Artemis Villa & hotel. Hopefully you will come back to Bali and stay with us.

Best regards
Nengah
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My husband and I stayed in one of the double hotel rooms for three nights and we were delighted with how spacious, quiet and private it was.  The hotel is laid out around a central pool and restaurant and our room was towards the back of the property but still on ground level with access from the main path.  There are a lot of plants and flowers and the place is really clean.  They have created a peaceful and relaxed atmosphere.  All the staff were really helpful and friendly and we really enjoyed our breakfasts - some of the most generous we encountered!  The hotel is located close to the beach and not far from a lot of shops so it was lovely to be able to access these areas and retreat to the tranquility of the hotel.
title: Tranquility and peace

owner_response.text:
Thank you for  your  staying with us at Artemis Villa & hotel.
Hopefully  you have enjoyed  your holidays. 

Best regards
Nengah
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I was expecting a really luxurious hotel for the price (£100 per night) it was second rate its all very closed in and cloisterphobic your "balcony" looks on to a wall a metre away with only one uncomfortable chair.I kept asking for a second one but was told there wasnt any.The sunloungers where quite old and the pool towels sad.Breakfast was ok but they always forgot something or got your order not quite right.The room itself was average, the bathroom had two open ends so avoiding mossies was hard even with the coils and spray I got badly bitten each night.There were no nice little touches,and been booked for a fortnight I got 2 free 1hour massages - one lasted 38 mins the other 42mins. I would not recommend artemis to anyone!
title: WHAT A DISAPPOINMENT

text: Just got back from a lovely holiday at Artemis with my girl friends. We stayed in their tastefully done up 2 bed pool villa which had an equiped kitchen (without microwave tho).  Artemis is conveniently located near shops, restaurants, clubs and importantly the beach! The staff are polite and ever willing to help. We had some issues with their wifi initially but the staff were quick to respond and fix the problems for us. A couple of things tho - we stayed 6 nights and the standard breakfast  and the exact same fruit platter day on day was a bit boring. The 2 bed villas have one bedroom in the main villa and a second one detached  - in case of young kids this may not be ideal. The toilets with openings near the sun roof attracted some unwelcome insects mostly at night.
title: Wonderful villa, great location

text:
Stayed here 3 nights

The resort is located in a great street,just down a narrow lane way.Quiet an peaceful resort.
Check in was smooth.We had the hotel room,spacious,large bathroom with bad / poor builders.The bathroom was so stained with grouting an vanish on the toilet was not good enough for a 4 star ,new 3 years old resort.They use cheap material in this room.The bathroom was the worst.it just didn't feel clean.There are 18 rooms only at this resort,which include villas with private pool.

Positives are :

Good location 10 mins to the beach,shops,restaurant in the street. 
Lovely pool ,very relaxing ,besides the breakfast area.
Wifi great all around the resort.
Breakfast was very nice,choice of 3 types of freshly cooked to order.etc,America,Asian,contenital.
Freshly squeeze juices or smoothies. 
Beds nice.comfortable.
Fragrances incense to burn in room.
Lovely gardens
Quiet location
There is library to borrow books from an Internet desk
Most staff were nice,breakfast girl on Monday was not friendly at all.

Negatives are:

The pillows had strain marks on them from other guest,didn't have pillow liner on them,just the pillow case.YUK !!!
Bathroom was built poorly.
Hair dryer was white with strained brown cord.
Bath looked second hand
Toilet was stained
Tiles were grouted roughly
Shower water went cold after 5 mins on Sunday nite.
Didn't like the open air shower window,had to shower in partial darkness as a building was next door.( you never know who's watching)
Hated the circle skylight in room ,light was in the room all the time at night.
Left a towel an 1 glass on the ground at pool at 9.30 am,it was still there at 6.30 pm.no one clean it up.
Beds were made from cheap wood.
Walls in room were very patched up.( bad builders)

Overall a good stay,was quiet an peaceful  and good value as its close to the beach ,shops,etc.l liked the street shops ,nice shopping.easy to  get a taxi on the street,just ask to go on the meter,it's cheaper!!!.Not sure if l would stay here again,it's was a nice stay,but if l find some thing else close to this street an nicer,than maybe I would stay there or maybe here again.

Ciao 
Mum & daughter.
title: Loved the location ,Nice shopping an restaurant !!!! Close to beach !!!1-2

photos.caption: strained pillows,yuk!! not good enough  for a 4 star resort.
bright skylight in my room at night,one dark,one bright!!!
twin beds,spacious an japanese touch with balinese style

text: I have just returned from 3 nights in Apartment G2.  It was a beautiful facility, located in a serene alley/road.  It was very private and then our villa felt very personal.  It is a manageable walk to the beach. The staff were accommodating and we felt that they had our best interests at hand.  It was all very clean, we felt comfortable eating at the restaurant.  Spa was good.  Owned by a Japanese couple, we loved the mix between Balinese and Japanese influence.  I would highly recommend this property and we would definitely return to the Artemis.
title: Teenage boys in tow!

text: The owner Madeh is a delightful person,showed us around his private home.The place is clean,the food good and very central.The rooms nice and cosy,the staff very friendly.Tastefully decorated and well kept.Will go there again
title: Very nice place

text: It is an oasis close to the beach. We stayed in an apartment, just huge and extremely comfortable. Fantastic bed and bathroom. Hotel pool has a reasonable size. Breakfast is delicious.  Front desk is efficient, but they wanted to charge US$25,00 for a check-out at 2 pm instead of 12:00. It was their right. We checked at 12:00, remained at the pool, and our room in front of us remained empty, even not cleaned. But restaurant service is not at the hotel level. It seems that 2 girls there  are trainees: they don't understand English, they chew gums when speaking to us, ordered wrong meals, etc...A pity because food was more than OK. Never saw one manager on duty. Might be the cause.
title: Nice place average service.

text: A potentially very well appointed hotel, with the benefit of private Villas with private pools, and A large hotel pool as well, with a bar and restaurant. It is about a 5 minute walk to the beach and a 5 minute taxi ride to Seminyak Shopping st. The Villas are good value for money, particularly if you are traveling with 3 children. It was a very safe place to stay, although off an alley way. Which had some +'s and -'s, the plus being it was quiet and self contained, the minus being it was a little dark at night, although it was never a concern and there are security guards as well at the entrance.The room was a two bedroom Villa and the area around the private pool needed some minor repairs, but for the amount we paid, it was huge, with two big bedrooms and beautiful bathrooms. the main room had a large fan and big kitchen, all the doors could be folded back. It was a very beautiful hotel, particularly the main pool.
title: Good place to chill out.

text:
I have stayed here in a 1 bedroom apartment previously and it was fine. But this time I stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa with private pool and was not satisfied at all. The Living area was huge with high ceilings but only 1 small fan too high up. This room became unbearably hot. Even though it was hot outside it was often cooler outside than inside the living area, making the living area unusable.
